definition: to burn/to cook/to stew/to bake/to roast/to heat/to boil (tea, water etc)/fever/to run a temperature/(coll.) to let things go to one's head
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130

sentences.english: Pls, come to the window, I will give you some red-roasted pork.
sentences.chinese: 到窗户边上来一下，我给你们盛了一碗红烧肉。

sentences.english: Food Suggestions: Enjoy with lamb dishes, soft cheeses and braised oxtail or pork in brown sauce.
sentences.chinese: 可与羊肉，软干酪，闷牛尾或红烧肉一起享用。

sentences.english: Since we download the coupons from the website, we have braised pork in brown sauce in free.
sentences.chinese: 因为从网上打了优惠券，所以，红烧肉是免费赠送的。

sentences.english: I will cook red-cooked meat for you three times every day after I have mastered how to cook it.
sentences.chinese: 将来我会做红烧肉了，一天三顿做给你吃啊。

sentences.english: I have eggplant, roasted meat and put the menu to him.
sentences.chinese: 我点了红烧茄子，红烧肉后便把菜单递给他点。

definition: stir-fried pork, favorite of Northern Song writer Su Shi 蘇軾|苏轼, a.k.a. Su Dongpo 蘇東坡|苏东坡
mapo tofu/stir-fried beancurd in chili sauce
pork chop/pork cutlet/spare ribs/(coll.) skinny person
pork strips stir-fried with yuxiang 魚香|鱼香[yu2 xiang1]
dish (type of food)/vegetable/cuisine/CL:盤|盘[pan2],道[dao4]/(coll.) (one's) type/(of one's skills etc) weak/poor
